meanings.definition: A person who juggles or performs tricks with objects
meanings.sent1: During the circus show, the talented jogglers amazed the audience with their skills.
meanings.sent2: The street performer entertained the crowd as a skilled jogglers.
meanings.sent3: The jogglers at the party made everyone laugh with their funny tricks.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to multitask at work made her seem like a professional jogglers.
meanings.sent5: The jogglers' performance was so captivating that no one could look away.

meanings.definition: A device used in masonry to support and align stones
meanings.sent1: The construction workers used jogglers to ensure the stones were properly aligned.
meanings.sent2: The ancient builders relied on jogglers to keep the structure stable.
meanings.sent3: The jogglers in the wall helped maintain its strength and durability.
meanings.sent4: The precision of the jogglers made the stone wall look seamless.
meanings.sent5: The master mason carefully placed each joggler to create a perfect fit.

meanings.definition: A tool used in woodworking to create a groove or joint
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a joggler to make precise cuts for the joint.
meanings.sent2: The joggler helped in creating a seamless connection between the wooden pieces.
meanings.sent3: The woodworking class learned how to use jogglers to enhance their projects.
meanings.sent4: The joggler's sharp edge made it easy to carve out the groove.
meanings.sent5: With the help of the joggler, the craftsman crafted a beautiful joint.
